name: Psalms of Peace
description: A 7-day journey through the psalms that speak directly to your anxious heart, guiding you toward the stillness and peace only God can give.

days.title: The Shepherd's Care
days.reflection: What does it mean for God to be your shepherd in this season of your life?

days.title: Confident in the Light
days.reflection: When have you experienced God as your light in a moment of darkness?

days.title: Taste and See
days.reflection: How has God delivered you from a fear that once held you captive?

days.title: God Is Our Refuge
days.reflection: Where do you need to 'be still and know' that He is God today?

days.title: Under His Wings
days.reflection: What does it feel like to dwell in the shelter of the Most High?

days.title: The Keeper Who Never Sleeps
days.reflection: How does knowing God never slumbers change the way you face tonight?

days.title: Fearfully and Wonderfully Made
days.reflection: What truth about how God knows you brings the most comfort right now?

name: The Gospel of John
description: Walk through the entire Gospel of John in 21 days and encounter Jesus — the Word made flesh — one chapter at a time.

days.title: The Word Made Flesh
days.reflection: What does it mean to you that Jesus existed before all things and chose to dwell among us?

days.title: Water into Wine
days.reflection: Where in your life do you need Jesus to transform the ordinary into something miraculous?

days.title: You Must Be Born Again
days.reflection: How does the idea of being 'born again' challenge or encourage your understanding of faith?

days.title: Living Water
days.reflection: What wells are you drawing from that leave you thirsty, and what would living water look like?

days.title: Healing at the Pool
days.reflection: Is there an area where you've been waiting for healing but haven't fully asked Jesus for it?

days.title: Bread of Life
days.reflection: What does it look like to feed on Jesus as the bread of life each day?

days.title: Rivers of Living Water
days.reflection: How do you respond when the world's opinions about Jesus conflict with your own experience of Him?

days.title: The Light of the World
days.reflection: Where do you need Jesus to shine His light into a place of shame or darkness?

days.title: Sight for the Blind
days.reflection: What is one area of spiritual blindness you'd like Jesus to open your eyes to?

days.title: The Good Shepherd
days.reflection: How does knowing that Jesus laid down His life willingly change your view of His love?

days.title: Lazarus, Come Forth
days.reflection: What dead area in your life do you need Jesus to call back to life?

days.title: Anointed for Burial
days.reflection: What is the most extravagant act of worship you could offer to Jesus today?

days.title: The Servant King
days.reflection: Whose feet is Jesus asking you to wash through humble service this week?

days.title: The Way, the Truth, the Life
days.reflection: How does Jesus' promise to prepare a place for you affect the way you live today?

days.title: The True Vine
days.reflection: What does it practically look like for you to 'abide' in Jesus this week?

days.title: The Helper Is Coming
days.reflection: How have you experienced the Holy Spirit guiding you into truth?

days.title: Jesus Prays for You
days.reflection: How does it feel to know that Jesus personally prayed for your unity with Him and the Father?

days.title: Betrayal and Arrest
days.reflection: When have you, like Peter, denied knowing Jesus through your words or actions?

days.title: It Is Finished
days.reflection: What burden are you carrying that Jesus already finished on the cross?

days.title: He Is Risen
days.reflection: How does the reality of the resurrection change the way you face your greatest fear?

days.title: Do You Love Me?
days.reflection: If Jesus asked you 'Do you love me?' three times today, how would your answer shape your actions?

name: 30 Days of Wisdom
description: One chapter of Proverbs for each day of the month — timeless wisdom for decisions, relationships, work, and daily life.

days.title: The Beginning of Wisdom
days.reflection: What does it mean for the fear of the Lord to be the starting point of all wisdom?

days.title: Seeking Hidden Treasure
days.reflection: How intentionally are you searching for wisdom the way you would search for hidden treasure?

days.title: Trust with All Your Heart
days.reflection: What decision are you facing where you need to trust God rather than lean on your own understanding?

days.title: Guard Your Heart
days.reflection: What are you allowing into your heart that may be pulling you away from the path of wisdom?

days.title: The Danger of Foolishness
days.reflection: Where in your life are you most tempted to take shortcuts that lead away from God's best?

days.title: Lessons from the Ant
days.reflection: What can the diligence of the ant teach you about your current responsibilities?

days.title: The Cost of Temptation
days.reflection: What boundaries do you need to set to protect yourself from temptation?

days.title: Wisdom Calls Out
days.reflection: How do you recognize the voice of wisdom calling to you amid the noise of daily life?

days.title: Two Invitations
days.reflection: Which invitation are you accepting more often — wisdom's feast or folly's shortcut?

days.title: The Wise Son
days.reflection: How does your character at home reflect the wisdom you seek in public?

days.title: Honest Scales
days.reflection: Where in your life do you need to pursue greater honesty and integrity?

days.title: Words That Heal
days.reflection: How can your words today bring healing instead of harm to someone around you?

days.title: Walking with the Wise
days.reflection: Who are the wise companions in your life, and how can you learn more from them?

days.title: The Way That Seems Right
days.reflection: When has a path that seemed right to you turned out to lead in the wrong direction?

days.title: A Gentle Answer
days.reflection: Who in your life needs a gentle answer from you instead of a harsh word?

days.title: Commit Your Plans
days.reflection: What plans are you holding onto that you need to commit fully to the Lord?

days.title: A Friend at All Times
days.reflection: How can you be a more faithful friend to someone who is walking through adversity?

days.title: A Strong Tower
days.reflection: When trouble comes, do you run first to the name of the Lord or to something else?

days.title: Kindness to the Poor
days.reflection: How can you show generosity to someone in need this week as an act of worship?

days.title: The King's Heart
days.reflection: How does trusting God's sovereignty over leaders and nations change the way you pray?

days.title: Justice and Righteousness
days.reflection: Where can you pursue justice and righteousness more faithfully in your everyday life?

days.title: A Good Name
days.reflection: What kind of reputation are you building, and does it reflect the character of Christ?

days.title: Do Not Envy
days.reflection: What triggers envy in your heart, and how can gratitude replace it?

days.title: Strength in Trouble
days.reflection: How do you respond when adversity tests the strength of your faith?

days.title: Apples of Gold
days.reflection: When was the last time someone's well-timed words were like apples of gold to you?

days.title: The Sluggard's Mirror
days.reflection: What area of laziness or procrastination is holding you back from God's best for you?

days.title: Iron Sharpens Iron
days.reflection: Who in your life sharpens you, and are you intentionally investing in that relationship?

days.title: The Righteous Are Bold
days.reflection: Where do you need more boldness to stand for what is right?

days.title: Vision and Obedience
days.reflection: How does having a vision rooted in God's Word keep you from wandering aimlessly?

days.title: Every Word of God
days.reflection: What does Agur's prayer — 'give me neither poverty nor riches' — teach you about contentment?

name: Romans: Heart of the Gospel
description: A 16-day deep dive into Paul's letter to the Romans — the most complete presentation of the gospel ever written.

days.title: The Gospel of God
days.reflection: Are you ever ashamed of the gospel, and what would it look like to live unashamed?

days.title: God's Righteous Judgment
days.reflection: How does knowing that God judges impartially affect the way you judge others?

days.title: All Have Sinned
days.reflection: How does the reality that all have sinned level the ground between you and everyone else?

days.title: Faith like Abraham
days.reflection: What impossible promise from God are you being called to believe by faith?

days.title: Peace with God
days.reflection: How does knowing that suffering produces perseverance change the way you view your trials?

days.title: Dead to Sin, Alive in Christ
days.reflection: What sin do you need to consider yourself dead to so that you can live fully for Christ?

days.title: The Struggle Within
days.reflection: How does Paul's honest struggle with sin encourage you in your own battle?

days.title: No Condemnation
days.reflection: What condemnation are you still carrying that Christ has already removed?

days.title: God's Sovereign Choice
days.reflection: How do you respond to the mystery of God's sovereignty and human responsibility?

days.title: The Word Is Near You
days.reflection: Who in your life needs to hear the good news, and what is holding you back from sharing it?

days.title: The Olive Tree
days.reflection: How does understanding your place as a 'grafted in' branch deepen your gratitude?

days.title: A Living Sacrifice
days.reflection: What does it practically look like to offer your body as a living sacrifice today?

days.title: Submission and Love
days.reflection: How can the command to 'owe nothing but love' reshape your relationships this week?

days.title: Do Not Judge Your Brother
days.reflection: Where do you need to extend more grace to a fellow believer whose convictions differ from yours?

days.title: Unity for God's Glory
days.reflection: How can you more actively pursue unity with other believers for the glory of God?

days.title: Greetings and the God of Peace
days.reflection: Who are the people God has placed around you to strengthen your faith, and have you thanked them?

name: New Believer's Journey
description: A 14-day guided tour through the most essential chapters of the Bible — perfect for anyone just beginning to explore the Christian faith.

days.title: Born Again
days.reflection: What does it mean to you to start over with a completely new spiritual life?

days.title: The Shepherd
days.reflection: How does picturing God as a shepherd caring for you change the way you feel about Him?

days.title: All Have Sinned
days.reflection: How does understanding that everyone falls short help you accept God's grace without shame?

days.title: The Gift of Grace
days.reflection: What does it mean to receive something you could never earn on your own?

days.title: No Condemnation
days.reflection: What guilt or shame do you need to release in light of the truth that there is no condemnation in Christ?

days.title: Saved by Grace
days.reflection: How does knowing that salvation is a gift — not a reward — change the pressure you put on yourself?

days.title: The Way, the Truth, the Life
days.reflection: What does it mean for Jesus to be the way when you feel lost or uncertain about the future?

days.title: God Is Love
days.reflection: How does the statement 'God is love' reshape your understanding of who God is?

days.title: The Peace of God
days.reflection: What worries can you bring to God right now in exchange for His peace that passes understanding?

days.title: The Hall of Faith
days.reflection: Which person of faith in this chapter inspires you most, and why?

days.title: Trials and Wisdom
days.reflection: How can you begin to see your current trials as an opportunity for growth rather than punishment?

days.title: The Beatitudes
days.reflection: Which of the Beatitudes speaks most directly to where you are in life right now?

days.title: The Lord's Prayer
days.reflection: How can the Lord's Prayer become a framework for the way you talk to God each day?

days.title: All Things New
days.reflection: How does the promise that God will make all things new give you hope for the future?

name: Finding Purpose
description: A 10-day exploration of Scripture's most powerful passages about identity, calling, and the purpose God has woven into your life.

days.title: Plans to Prosper You
days.reflection: How does knowing God has plans for your welfare and future change the way you face uncertainty?

days.title: Wonderfully Made
days.reflection: What would change if you truly believed you were fearfully and wonderfully made?

days.title: Trust in the Lord
days.reflection: What path are you trying to direct on your own instead of acknowledging God in it?

days.title: Created for Good Works
days.reflection: What good works do you sense God prepared in advance for you to walk in?

days.title: A Living Sacrifice
days.reflection: How can you use the unique gifts God gave you to serve others this week?

days.title: Called by Name
days.reflection: How does God calling you by name and claiming you as His own shape your sense of identity?

days.title: To Live Is Christ
days.reflection: If 'to live is Christ,' what does that mean for the way you approach your work and relationships?

days.title: Set Your Mind Above
days.reflection: What earthly thing are you clinging to that is distracting you from the things above?

days.title: A Chosen People
days.reflection: How does being called 'a royal priesthood' redefine your sense of purpose and belonging?

days.title: Delight in the Lord
days.reflection: What happens to your desires when you commit to delighting in the Lord above all else?

name: Comfort in Hard Times
description: A 7-day refuge in Scripture for seasons of suffering — these passages have carried believers through the darkest valleys for thousands of years.

days.title: The Lord Is Near the Brokenhearted
days.reflection: How does knowing that God is especially close to the brokenhearted comfort you right now?

days.title: Fear Not, I Am with You
days.reflection: What fear are you carrying that God is asking you to release into His hands?

days.title: The God of All Comfort
days.reflection: How might your own suffering equip you to comfort someone else who is hurting?

days.title: Nothing Can Separate Us
days.reflection: What circumstance has made you feel separated from God's love, and how does this chapter speak to that?

days.title: Be Still and Know
days.reflection: What noise in your life do you need to silence so you can hear God say 'Be still'?

days.title: Come to Me and Rest
days.reflection: What heavy burden are you carrying that Jesus is inviting you to lay down today?

days.title: Every Tear Wiped Away
days.reflection: How does the promise that God will wipe every tear from your eyes give you strength to endure today?

name: The Sermon on the Mount
description: A 7-day close study of Jesus' most famous sermon — the radical teaching that turned the world's values upside down.

days.title: The Beatitudes and Salt of the Earth
days.reflection: Which beatitude challenges you the most, and what would it look like to live it out today?

days.title: A Higher Righteousness
days.reflection: How does Jesus' call to 'be perfect as your Father is perfect' push you beyond rule-following into heart transformation?

days.title: Giving, Praying, and Fasting in Secret
days.reflection: Where do you need to shift your spiritual practices from being seen by others to being seen by God alone?

days.title: Treasure in Heaven
days.reflection: What are you anxious about that Jesus is asking you to trust Him with completely?

days.title: Do Not Judge
days.reflection: What plank in your own eye do you need to address before pointing out the speck in someone else's?

days.title: Built on the Rock
days.reflection: Is your life built on the rock of Jesus' words, or on the sand of the world's wisdom?

days.title: The Sermon as a Whole
days.reflection: After reading the entire Sermon on the Mount, what one teaching do you most want to put into practice?

name: Psalms in 30 Days
description: Read through all 150 Psalms in 30 days — five psalms a day to immerse yourself in the Bible's richest book of worship, prayer, and praise.

days.title: Psalms 1–5: The Blessed and the Broken
days.reflection: What does it mean to you to delight in the law of the Lord day and night?

days.title: Psalms 6–10: Crying Out to God
days.reflection: How does the honesty of the psalmist's cries to God give you permission to bring your raw emotions to Him?

days.title: Psalms 11–15: The Righteous and the Wicked
days.reflection: What does Psalm 15 reveal about the kind of person who can dwell in God's presence?

days.title: Psalms 16–20: Refuge and Rescue
days.reflection: How do the heavens declaring God's glory in Psalm 19 stir worship in your own heart?

days.title: Psalms 21–25: The Shepherd and the Seeker
days.reflection: How does Psalm 22's cry of forsakenness — echoed by Jesus on the cross — deepen your understanding of His sacrifice?

days.title: Psalms 26–30: Light in Darkness
days.reflection: What does it mean that weeping may last for a night but joy comes in the morning?

days.title: Psalms 31–35: Trust and Deliverance
days.reflection: How does the blessing of forgiveness in Psalm 32 encourage you to confess what you've been hiding?

days.title: Psalms 36–40: Steadfast Love
days.reflection: What does 'delight yourself in the Lord' from Psalm 37 look like in your daily routine?

days.title: Psalms 41–45: Thirst for God
days.reflection: When has your soul thirsted for God the way a deer pants for water?

days.title: Psalms 46–50: God Is Our Fortress
days.reflection: How does Psalm 46's reminder to 'be still' speak to the chaos in your life right now?

days.title: Psalms 51–55: A Broken Spirit
days.reflection: How does David's prayer for a clean heart in Psalm 51 give you courage to approach God with your failures?

days.title: Psalms 56–60: When I Am Afraid
days.reflection: What does 'when I am afraid, I will trust in you' from Psalm 56 look like in your current circumstances?

days.title: Psalms 61–65: Rest in God Alone
days.reflection: Where do you find rest — truly in God alone, or are you looking to other sources for peace?

days.title: Psalms 66–70: Shout for Joy
days.reflection: What awesome works of God in your life would you want to tell others about?

days.title: Psalms 71–75: Everlasting Hope
days.reflection: How does the psalmist's struggle with envy in Psalm 73 mirror your own experience?

days.title: Psalms 76–80: Remember His Wonders
days.reflection: What past acts of God can you remember and rehearse to strengthen your faith today?

days.title: Psalms 81–85: Revival and Restoration
days.reflection: How does the longing for God's courts in Psalm 84 resonate with your desire for worship?

days.title: Psalms 86–90: From Everlasting to Everlasting
days.reflection: How does Psalm 90's perspective on the brevity of life change the way you value your time?

days.title: Psalms 91–95: Shelter and Song
days.reflection: What does it mean to dwell in the shelter of the Most High, and how can you practice that today?

days.title: Psalms 96–100: The Lord Reigns
days.reflection: How does the call to 'make a joyful noise' in Psalm 100 challenge you to worship with greater enthusiasm?

days.title: Psalms 101–105: Bless the Lord, O My Soul
days.reflection: What benefits from the Lord listed in Psalm 103 have you forgotten to thank Him for?

days.title: Psalms 106–110: Remembering God's Faithfulness
days.reflection: How have you experienced God's steadfast love rescuing you from your own wandering?

days.title: Psalms 111–115: Praise the Lord
days.reflection: How does the contrast between living God and lifeless idols in Psalm 115 challenge where you place your trust?

days.title: Psalms 116–120: Songs of Ascent Begin
days.reflection: What verse from the longest psalm — Psalm 119 — speaks most powerfully to your love for God's Word?

days.title: Psalms 121–125: Ascending to the Lord
days.reflection: Where does your help come from, and how does Psalm 121 strengthen your confidence in God's protection?

days.title: Psalms 126–130: Sowing in Tears
days.reflection: What seeds are you sowing in tears right now, trusting that you will reap with shouts of joy?

days.title: Psalms 131–135: Humble Trust
days.reflection: How does the image of unity in Psalm 133 inspire you to pursue deeper fellowship with other believers?

days.title: Psalms 136–140: His Love Endures Forever
days.reflection: How does the refrain 'His love endures forever' in Psalm 136 anchor you when everything else feels uncertain?

days.title: Psalms 141–145: Evening Prayers
days.reflection: How does David's declaration that God is great and greatly to be praised shape your evening prayer tonight?

days.title: Psalms 146–150: Let Everything Praise the Lord
days.reflection: As the Psalms close with 'let everything that has breath praise the Lord,' how will you make praise a daily habit?
